# Khurram Anwar Qadri

Khurram Anwar Qadri is a serving two-star general in the Pakistan Army, currently serving as  Director General of Military Vehicles Research and Development Establishment (DG MVRDE) at GHQ, Rawalpindi.
Education
Qadri completed his Mechanical Engineering Degree from NED University of Engineering and Technology.
Military career
Qadri commissioned in 10 Electrical and Mechanical Engineers Battalion through Integrated Course. He was promoted to the rank of Major General from Brigadier in 2019.
He is currently serving as Director General of Military Vehicles Research and Development Establishment (DG MVRDE) at General Headquarters Rawalpindi. He led delegation of Ministry of Defence delegation to Pakistan Association of Automotive Parts and Accessories Manufacturers.
He received Hilal-i-Imtiaz from the President of Pakistan Arif Alvi in 2021.
